message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product. It's designed to meet your needs perfectly, and I believe it's worth more than its value to you. Would you like to purchase it today?
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $120. Is that something you'd be willing to consider?

Thank you for your interest in our product, Bob. I understand your budget constraints, but unfortunately, we can't match the price you're suggesting. Our current offer stands at $135. I hope this aligns better with your expectations.
I'm still interested in the product, but I really think $120 is a fair price for it. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $130. Can you consider that?

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Bob. After careful consideration, I am able to offer the product at $132. This is the best price I can manage while still ensuring a reasonable profit for us. I hope this works for you.
I appreciate your flexibility, Alice. I'm willing to meet you at $128. That's the best I can do. Can you consider that?
Thank you for your offer, Bob. I'm glad we could come closer. Considering the value of the product and our costs, I can agree to sell it to you at $129. I hope this meets your expectations.
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, Alice. I'm willing to meet you at $126. That's the lowest I'm willing to go. Can you consider that?

I understand your position, Bob. After reevaluating our costs and the value proposition of the product, I can agree to sell it to you at $127. This is my final offer within our negotiation parameters.

I appreciate your flexibility, Alice. I'm willing to meet you at $125. That's the absolute maximum I'm willing to pay. If you can agree to that, I'll buy the product from you. If not, I'll have to consider other options.
